de.affect.compute

Class EmotionEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.affect.compute.EmotionEngine

  • public class EmotionEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The EmotionEngine class is used to infer the emotional state of an agent based on a list of Emotion Eliciting Conditions.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard (based on the work of Michael Kipp and Martin Klesen)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmotionEngine(Personality personality, DecayFunction decayFunction)
      Constructs a new EmotionEngine object with the specified personality for the agent doing the emotional appraisal.

      Adds a new element to the list of Emotion Eliciting Conditions.

      Removes all elements from the list of Emotion Eliciting Conditions.
      EmotionVector decay(EmotionHistory history, EmotionVector emotions, EmotionVector defaultEmotions)
      Decays the specified emotion history using the engine's decay function.
      EmotionVector inferEmotions(EmotionVector emotions, EmotionHistory history, Mood mood)
      Infers all emotions based on the list of Emotion Eliciting Conditions and adds them to the specified collection.
      java.util.List simulateDecay(Emotion emotion)
      Simulates the future decay of a specific emotion using the engine's decay function.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmotionEngine

        public EmotionEngine(Personality personality,
             DecayFunction decayFunction)
        Constructs a new EmotionEngine object with the specified personality for the agent doing the emotional appraisal.
        Parameters:
        personality - the agent's personality
        decayFunction - the engine's emotion decay function
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the personality or the decay function is not specified.

    • Method Detail

      • addEEC

        public void addEEC(EEC eec)
        Adds a new element to the list of Emotion Eliciting Conditions. This method throws an IllegalStateException if an an EEC for event-based emotions, action-based emotions, or object-based emotions already exists to prevent the generation of emotions of the same type. This is necessary since the EmotionVector used to store the infered emotions contains exactly one emotion for each emotion type.
        Parameters:
        eec - the new Emotion Eliciting Condition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Emotion Eliciting Condition is not specified.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if an EEC for event-based emotions, action-based emotions, or object-based emotions already exists.
        See Also:
        EmotionVector

      • clearEEC

        public void clearEEC()
        Removes all elements from the list of Emotion Eliciting Conditions.

      • decay

        public EmotionVector decay(EmotionHistory history,
                  EmotionVector emotions,
                  EmotionVector defaultEmotions)
        Decays the specified emotion history using the engine's decay function. This method decays each element in the emotion history and returns the new emotional state. It generates an EmotionChangeEvent to signal that the emotional state has changed.
        Parameters:
        history - the emotion history
        emotions - the collection used to store the emotional state
        Returns:
        the new emotional state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if no history is specified.
        See Also:
        getEmotionalState(EmotionVector emotions)

      • simulateDecay

        public java.util.List simulateDecay(Emotion emotion)
        Simulates the future decay of a specific emotion using the engine's decay function.
        Parameters:
        emotion - the emotion that will be decayed
        Returns:
        List of intesity values that denotes the decay of the emotion
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if no history is specified.

      • inferEmotions

        public EmotionVector inferEmotions(EmotionVector emotions,
                          EmotionHistory history,
                          Mood mood)
        Infers all emotions based on the list of Emotion Eliciting Conditions and adds them to the specified collection. If the type of an infered emotion is not contained in the predefined set of emotion types this emotion will be ignored.

        If a compound emotion (e.g. Gratitude) can be infered then the two corresponding single emotions ( Joy and Admiration) are not returned as part of the result.

        Parameters:
        emotions - the emotions to which the infered one will be added
        history - the emotion history
        Returns:
        the modified collection of emotions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the emotion history is not specified.
